newsitem.title: MEXICO: Pemex begins refining plant of 3,440 bpd capacity.
newsitem.headline: Pemex begins refining plant of 3,440 bpd capacity.

text.p: Mexico's state oil and gas monopoly Petroleos Mexicanos (Pemex) said it began operations on Wednesday at a new alkylation refining plant with a capacity of 3,440 barrel per day (bpd).
The company said the new Salamanca, Guanajuato plant cost $23.5 million to build and will reduce the country's imports of alkylines.

"This modern industrial unit...is the first in a series of four that are in the construction process in the national refining system, among important actions that Petroleos Mexicanos is taking to reduce pollution," Pemex said in a statement.
Alkylation is the process for blending high-octane gasolines -- forming lighter compounds such as isobutane and butylene by processing heavier ones by use of heat and a catalyst.

Pemex has been moving to boost its refining activity to process a glut of its heavy Maya crude into finished products. Maya export prices fell to $14.48 per barrel for March from $20.56 per barrel average in October.
The new plant was constructed by Spanish company Mecanica de la Pena, the company said.
